meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Albania, equal to 100 qintars.
meanings.sent1: In Albania, you can buy many things with just one qintar.
meanings.sent2: The qintar is the main currency used in Albania.
meanings.sent3: I tried paying with a qintar made of chocolate, but the cashier didn't accept it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a qintar, valuable and bright.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the qintar jingling in his pocket was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight used in the Middle East, equal to about 50 kilograms.
meanings.sent1: The farmer lifted the heavy qintar of wheat effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: They measured the goods in qintars before loading them onto the truck.
meanings.sent3: Carrying a qintar of feathers would be much easier than a qintar of rocks.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him weighed more than a qintar of gold.
meanings.sent5: The qintar of responsibility on his shoulders felt heavier with each passing day.
